Ted....seems the tempest in the teapot continues. The saddest part of this entire Covid virus is that no one is telling the entire story. 80% of all deaths occur in people over the age of 65. Many of those under 65 who have died have had compromising health issues which narrows the real threat to many of the infected to about 10% of all deaths. Certainly masks, distancing and cleanliness will help diminish infection but the reality is that for 90% of those infected they will recover. So it seems to me that we should be protecting the elderly more vigorously than any other age demographic. I lost my mother to Covid in May due to poor management in the care facility in which she resided. So as I see it, if you are 65 or older you have a real problem otherwise all this ballyhoo about Covid is nothing more than an absurd concoction perpetrated on the general public by the fourth estate and dirty politicians.https:/…older-adults.html
On possitive note, the US federal government is saving about 160 million a month in social security payments they no longer have to make.
